alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Jefferson; St. Clair; Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 4:31PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Talladega, Calhoun, east central Jefferson and St. Clair Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 431 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Neely Henry Lake to near Leeds. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Birmingham, Anniston, Oxford, Trussville, Pell City, Jacksonville, Leeds, Moody, Rainbow City, Piedmont, Springville, Odenville, West End-Cobb Town, Cobb Town, Fort McClellan, Saks, Center Point, Clay, Lincoln and Glencoe. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
